niagara.query_engine
Class QueryThread

java.lang.Object
  niagara.query_engine.QueryThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class QueryThread
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

The QueryThread class is used to run queries after they are entered into the query engine system through executeQuery(String). Each query thread does the following:

  • Parse the query producing a logical operator tree
  • Give this tree to the Optimizer, which produces an optimized tree
  • Instatiate this tree by creating PhysicalOperators for each logical node
  • Give this physical operator tree to the scheduler which places ops into the PhysicalOperatorBuffer.
  • PhysicalOperatorThreads are primed, and consume and run these Physical Operators.

See Also:
QueryOptimizer, ExecutionScheduler, PhysicalOperator, PhysicalOperatorThread, QueryParser, QueryEngine

Constructor Detail

QueryThread

public QueryThread(DataManager dataManager,
                   QueryQueue queryQueue,
                   ExecutionScheduler scheduler)
Constructor for QueryThread class. Initialized with an QueryQueue to block on, and an ExecutionScheduler. A Java thread is created and is associated with the Query Thread.

Parameters:
dataManager - the data manager (common to query engine)
queryQueue - the name of the query queue with which the
scheduler - the execution scheduler (shared by all query threads)
Method Detail

run

public void run()
This is the run method invoked by the Java thread - it simply grabs the next query, executes it, and then repeats.
